result.execSummary:
The defendant Shalin L. MANTHE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Seek and/or maintain fulltime employment at the agent's discretion.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with any of the victims or anyone under the age of 18 without the agent's premission, with the exception of her own children.

Comply with the Sex Offender Registry.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.   
Count 1 - Second degree sexual assault of child - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, obstruct officer.   Motion granted.   Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.   Report to be filed by 04-01-16.  Sentencing hearing is set for 04-08-16 at 8:30 a.m.   Defendant must submit DNA sample.   
Minutes.
Statement of Negotiated Plea.

Defendant in custody.   
Counsel argue.  Court denies the motion to modify bail, but will add a condition that the defendant may have visitation with the child, N.C.B., DOB: 12-09-12 under the supervision of Department of Human Services.  All other conditions will remain in effect.
Minutes.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification
Letter from defendant to Judge Fox.
to JLF from defendant, re:  bail modification.
Motion for Bail Modification set for 12/15/2015, at 10:30 a.m.
Philip Hoff, through public defender.
Petition to Withdraw as Counsel of Record and Order.
At 1:28 p.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon.
Affidavit of Detective Michael Stone, Manitowoc City Police Department.
Search warrant issued.  RE:  DNA testing from Shalin Manthe.
Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings. 
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with DA set for 11-18-2015 at 11:30 a.m.  Plea date is set for 02-17-2016 at 3:00 p.m.   
BAIL MOTION
Counsel argue. Court modifies cash bail to $3,000.00 and allows visitation with her infant child only, with supervision from DHS. All other conditions still apply. Motion granted.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.
Minutes.
Motion for Bail Modification.
Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Entered in error.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-30-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of sexual assault of a child and obstruct officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-28-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with B.C.S., DOB: 08-31-2000, anyone under the age of 18, including her own children and Jeremiah Behnke.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody. Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
